author: LMG Clips
description:
Thanks to our LMG clips sponsors dbrand, Dell, and Secretlab. You can check them out at the links below:

dbrand: https://dbrand.com/pcb
Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke revisit Philips’ abandoned Fixables program, which promised 3D-printable replacement parts but delivered only two models before going silent. They call out the wasted potential and praise companies that do actually support repairability and sustainability.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aXQuqaXt3yw

► GET MERCH: https://lttstore.com
► GET EXCLUSIVE CONTENT ON FLOATPLANE: https://lmg.gg/lttfloatplane

title: Philips, You Were The Chosen One

HP is removing support pages for their older products. Linus and Luke discuss everything from laziness, anti-consumer practices, and difficulties making older hardware harder to use.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aXQuqaXt3yw

title: HP Keeps Getting Worse

Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Capcom doesn’t see much value in re-releasing their original games, but Linus and Luke explore why preserving classic versions still matters. They share their own experiences with remakes and the quirks that made the originals special. Maybe the old jank was part of the charm all along?

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aXQuqaXt3yw

title: Capcom Says No to Nostalgia

ChatGPT is having some trouble when asked about a seahorse emoji. Linus and Luke discuss and demonstrate the bizarre ChatGPT glitch, which causes the AI to loop endlessly through nonsensical emoji combinations and corrections.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aXQuqaXt3yw

title: ChatGPT Had a Breakdown Over a Seahorse
